title-group.article-title: Statistical Models of Bond Ratings: A Methodological Inquiry

abstract.p: Previously developed models for predicting bond ratings are summarized and criticized. A statistical procedure appropriate to the ordinal nature of a bond rating is applied to a recent sample of seasoned and newly issued bonds. A simple linear model using a subordination dummy variable, total assets, the long-term debt to total-assets ratio, and the common stock systematic risk measure can correctly classify two-thirds of a holdout sample of newly issued bonds. Further analysis reveals that the model may be predicting the actual risk of a bond better than the rating agency in about half of the "misclassifications."
